content:
• Wednesday, March 28, 2012
  • SABA

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA) -3.1% AH after delaying its FQ3 earnings release. Saba, which had...

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA) -3.1% AH after delaying its FQ3 earnings release. Saba, which had been due to report after tomorrow's close, says it needs more time to "complete an internal review of the accounting treatment of certain international transactions." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM
  • FOSL

    Fossil (NASDAQ:FOSL) will be added to the S&P 500. The company will replace Medco Health...

    Fossil (NASDAQ:FOSL) will be added to the S&P 500. The company will replace Medco Health (NYSE:MHS), which will soon be acquired by Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX), provided regulators don't get in the way. FOSL +2.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • FUL

    H. B. Fuller (NYSE:FUL): FQ1 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $375M (+10.5% Y/Y) beats by...

    H. B. Fuller (NYSE:FUL): FQ1 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $375M (+10.5% Y/Y) beats by $15M. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM
  • RHT

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) guides on its FQ4 earnings call (webcast) for FQ1 revenue of $307M-$311M and...

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) guides on its FQ4 earnings call (webcast) for FQ1 revenue of $307M-$311M and EPS of $0.25-$0.27, compared with a consensus of $306.2M and $0.27 (aggressive spending is limiting EPS). It's also guiding for FY13 revenue of $1.34B-$1.36B and EPS of $1.16-$1.20, above a consensus of $1.3B and $1.15. Red Hat adds its off-balance-sheet backlog (not covered by deferred revenue) is now above $200M. Shares +8.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • DS

    Newcastle Investment (NCT) -5.9% AH after announcing a 16.5M share stock offering, good for...

    Newcastle Investment (NCT) -5.9% AH after announcing a 16.5M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $106.9M based on today's close. The real estate investment firm intends to partly use the proceeds to "make investments in excess mortgage servicing rights." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • MOS

    More on Mosaic (NYSE:MOS): Net potash sales off 27% Y/Y. Gross margins on potash 49% vs. 54%....

    More on Mosaic (NYSE:MOS): Net potash sales off 27% Y/Y. Gross margins on potash 49% vs. 54%. Phosphate sales +13% Y/Y, gross margins 16% vs. 31%, reflecting higher raw material costs. FQ4 potash sales expected 1.7-2.2M tons (FQ3=1.1M), phosphate sales 2.3-2.7M tons (FQ3=2.6M). Annual dividend is increased 150% to $0.50/share. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • RHT

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) follows up on its strong FQ4 report by announcing a $300M stock buyback...

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) follows up on its strong FQ4 report by announcing a $300M stock buyback program, good for repurchasing ~3% of all shares at current levels. The new program will replace an existing one that was used to repurchase $76.3M worth of shares last quarter. RHT now +7.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • CASC

    Oncothyreon (ONTY) -5.1% AH after announcing a stock offering of undisclosed size. The company...

    Oncothyreon (ONTY) -5.1% AH after announcing a stock offering of undisclosed size. The company plans to use the proceeds to fund the development of its PX-866 cancer drug, as well as its ONT-10 vaccine. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • RHT

    More on Red Hat's (NYSE:RHT) FQ4: The company's deferred revenue balance hit $946.7M, +16% Q/Q...

    More on Red Hat's (NYSE:RHT) FQ4: The company's deferred revenue balance hit $946.7M, +16% Q/Q and +23% Y/Y, and representing a major pickup in growth from FQ3. This contributed to free cash flow of $114.1M, nearly twice the company's $57.2M in net income. Gross margin hit 85%, up 200 bps Y/Y. $76.3M worth of shares were repurchased. RHT +5.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • RECN

    More on Resources Connection (NASDAQ:RECN): FQ3 beats on both revenue and a per share basis on...

    More on Resources Connection (NASDAQ:RECN): FQ3 beats on both revenue and a per share basis on better top line performance. Net earnings surged as the outsourcing and advisory company continued to see moderate revenue growth, led by its U.S. business. Shares +4.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • PAYX

    More on Paychex (NASDAQ:PAYX): FQ3 comes in line with estimates on a 4.1% increase in revenue....

    More on Paychex (NASDAQ:PAYX): FQ3 comes in line with estimates on a 4.1% increase in revenue. Total service revenue increased 8% to $558.5M, while Human Resource Services revenue increased 12% to $172.0M. -1.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • RLH

    Red Lion Hotels (NYSE:RLH) +9.1% AH after announcing it has hired BofA Merrill to "explore...

    Red Lion Hotels (NYSE:RLH) +9.1% AH after announcing it has hired BofA Merrill to "explore strategic alternatives," including a possible sale of the company. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • RHT

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT): FQ4 EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $297M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $6M....

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT): FQ4 EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $297M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • QSFT

    Quest Software (QSFT -2.5%) falls to $23.36 after DealReporter writes the company's efforts to...

    Quest Software (QSFT -2.5%) falls to $23.36 after DealReporter writes the company's efforts to find a bidder willing to top Insight Venture Partners' $23/share offer aren't generating much interest. Speculation has run high (I, II) that a major enterprise tech company will bid for the systems management software vendor.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • CHTP

    Trading in Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP -3.4%) has been halted, pending the results of the FDA's...

    Trading in Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP -3.4%) has been halted, pending the results of the FDA's PDUFA action review of Northera due out momentarily.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 4 Comments
  • OSGB

    Overseas Shipholding (OSG +7.8%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Hold at Dahlman Rose, saying...

    Overseas Shipholding (OSG +7.8%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Hold at Dahlman Rose, saying the shipper's risk/reward profile is favorable ahead of what the firm sees as a fundamental recovery in tanker rates over the next 12 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • AFFY

    Baird flies in the face of the Affymax (OTC:AFFY -8.1%) bloodbath, raising its price target to...

    Baird flies in the face of the Affymax (OTC:AFFY -8.1%) bloodbath, raising its price target to $17 from $15 following the FDA's approval of its anemia drug Omontys. The firm says recent weakness was primarily due to pricing concerns but they consider the weakness a buying opportunity. Shares are currently rated Outperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • NVDA

    JMP Securities hikes its rating on graphics-chip maker Nvidia (NVDA +2%) to Market Perform,...

    JMP Securities hikes its rating on graphics-chip maker Nvidia (NVDA +2%) to Market Perform, based on growing evidence that margins and booking trends have bottomed and are likely to improve going forward. "Fundamentals have turned the corner for Nvidia,” the firm says, seeing "broadening evidence that a recovery in computing fundamentals is underway."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • FSM

    Shares of Fortuna Silver Mines (FSM -19.9%) take a beating today after CIBC cut its rating to...

    Shares of Fortuna Silver Mines (FSM -19.9%) take a beating today after CIBC cut its rating to Sector Outperformer early this morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • BMY

    Amylin (AMLN +48.6%) investors cheer the rumor it rejected a $3.5B offer from Bristol-Myers...

    Amylin (AMLN +48.6%) investors cheer the rumor it rejected a $3.5B offer from Bristol-Myers Squibb, and analysts expect higher bids. Deutsche Bank says AMLN could be worth up to $31/share given an "acquirer with diabetes sales force can cut SG&A by 80% and R&D by 40%." Piper Jaffray names BMY, MRK and TKPYY.PK as potential sutiors; Leerink Swann suggests AZN.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • HTS

    Hatteras Financial (HTS +1.6%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Deutsche Bank, citing...

    Hatteras Financial (HTS +1.6%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Deutsche Bank, citing attractive returns on the company’s new capital. The firm keeps its $31 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • BB

    The Street's beatdown of Research In Motion (RIMM -1.7%) continues, as Charter Equity repeats...

    The Street's beatdown of Research In Motion (RIMM -1.7%) continues, as Charter Equity repeats its Underperform rating, noting that “with channel checks suggesting weak sell-through of Blackberry 7 models, and the release date for Blackberry 10 unclear, further share loss seems all but inevitable." RIMM will report Feb. quarter results after the close tomorrow.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • GEOKQ

    Microcap Geokinetics (GOK -6.3%) dips after being downgraded to Underperform this morning at...

    Microcap Geokinetics (GOK -6.3%) dips after being downgraded to Underperform this morning at Raymond James, citing its Q4 miss last week plus 10-K delays.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • SWSH

    Swisher Hygiene (SWSH -10.2%) will file for an extension for the release of its Q4 earnings due...

    Swisher Hygiene (SWSH -10.2%) will file for an extension for the release of its Q4 earnings due March 30 and says its audit committee is reviewing prior quarterly reports for 2011, which investors should no longer rely upon. The adjustments are “non-cash in nature and we strongly believe that they will not diminish our financial position or strong capital structure," CEOÂ Steven Berrard says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • HII

    Shares of shipbuilder Huntington Ingalls (HII +7.8%) jump after its Q4 results easily beat...

    Shares of shipbuilder Huntington Ingalls (HII +7.8%) jump after its Q4 results easily beat revenue and per share estimates. Earnings rose 9.5%, due in large part to a goodwill adjustment, as top line results from its Newport News shipbuilding business continue to improve.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • UNF

    UniFirst (UNF +2.5%) moves higher after its FQ2 results beat estimates across the board this...

    UniFirst (UNF +2.5%) moves higher after its FQ2 results beat estimates across the board this morning. Earnings jumped 18% Y/Y as the uniform-rental company saw improved profits and better margins from all business segments. The company again raised its full-year earnings estimate, now expecting to earn $4.10 - $4.12 per share on revenue of $1.24B - $1.25B.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • BCOV

    Online video hosting provider Brightcove (BCOV +4.1%) jumps on its first day of receiving...

    Online video hosting provider Brightcove (BCOV +4.1%) jumps on its first day of receiving analyst (i.e. underwriter) coverage following a strong IPO. Pac Crest's Brendan Barnicle is among the bulls, arguing Brightcove, whose services include ad monetization solutions, will benefit as web video continues increasing its share of the online advertising market.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • BNNY

    Jim Cramer says that Annie's (NYSE:BNNY) tremendous growth potential and its position in an...

    Jim Cramer says that Annie's (NYSE:BNNY) tremendous growth potential and its position in an attractive niche market make it a safe buy (video) even as it blows past its IPO price. The upscale food seller banks on health-conscious consumers staying loyal to its brands, as it tries to maintain its pace of annual double-digit growth. Shares of BNNY +86.9% to $35.51.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • KNOL

    Shares of Knology (KNOL +2.8%) launch higher off of reports that the firm has hired advisers to...

    Shares of Knology (KNOL +2.8%) launch higher off of reports that the firm has hired advisers to help guide it through a potential sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • SNX

    Citigroup weighs in on Synnex's (SNX -14%) disappointing FQ1 result, downgrading the shares to...

    Citigroup weighs in on Synnex's (SNX -14%) disappointing FQ1 result, downgrading the shares to Neutral on the back of the weak FQ2 guidance. The firm, however, did raise its price target to $42 from $39.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • MKL

    Markel (MKL +4%) gains after being upgraded to Buy at Stifel Nicolaus this morning. Stifel cites...

    Markel (MKL +4%) gains after being upgraded to Buy at Stifel Nicolaus this morning. Stifel cites an increase in statutory reserves that signal more redundancies, which should drive book value.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -11.9%) shares give back a chunk of their three-day 60% gains after...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -11.9%) shares give back a chunk of their three-day 60% gains after a downgrade from Piper Jaffray. The stock could continue to rise if an FDA advisory panel recommends approval for ARNA's obesity drug, but it has become a risky proposition at current levels. If the panel fails to approve, ARNA shares could fall to ~$1, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 3 Comments
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR -3.4%) shares slide as a Morningstar analysis points to an array of problems with...

    Petrobras (PBR -3.4%) shares slide as a Morningstar analysis points to an array of problems with the Brazilian oil giant. There's little doubt about PBR's resource potential, but there are a host of other issues for investors: refining losses, the ability to execute its ambitious growth plans, and shifting offshore dynamics relating to new Brazilian oil and gas laws.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • EXPE

    Expedia (EXPE -3.2%) adds to yesterday's losses after Liberty Interactive (LINTA) discloses it...

    Expedia (EXPE -3.2%) adds to yesterday's losses after Liberty Interactive (LINTA) discloses it sold 12M shares at a price of $34.32. The sales reduces Liberty's stake in Expedia to 16% from 26%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • UHS

    Universal Health (UHS -2.5%) has agreed to pay $6.85M to settle a false claims lawsuit that...

    Universal Health (UHS -2.5%) has agreed to pay $6.85M to settle a false claims lawsuit that alleges they provided substandard psychiatric counseling and treatment to adolescents in violation of Medicaid requirements, falsified records and submitted false claims to the Medicaid program.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • NYX

    NYSE Euronext (NYX -3.2%) slips after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to Sell, based on a...

    NYSE Euronext (NYX -3.2%) slips after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to Sell, based on a weakening market share and tepid global volume trends.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Shares of U.S. coal companies (KOL -2.7%) sink after yesterday's announcement of stricter carbon...

    Shares of U.S. coal companies (KOL -2.7%) sink after yesterday's announcement of stricter carbon emissions regulations proposed for coal-fired power plants. But Sterne Agee thinks the EPA proposals will have a "minimal" effect on coal-fired generation, affirming Buy ratings on ANR, BTU, CNX and JRCC despite "a much more onerous pricing and volume environment" expected in 2012-14.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 6 Comments
  • IAC

    InterActiveCorp (IACI -2.8%) dips after being downgraded to Neutral on valuation at Citigroup....

    InterActiveCorp (IACI -2.8%) dips after being downgraded to Neutral on valuation at Citigroup. The stock has been a recent favorite of hedge funds, gaining over 20% and outperforming its peers since late December. The firm keeps its $53 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP +11.1%) just won't take a breather. Shares are following up on yesterday's rally with...

    Yelp (YELP +11.1%) just won't take a breather. Shares are following up on yesterday's rally with another big move higher in the absence of major news. For those curious, Yelp is now up 40% from its post-IPO opening price, and is trading at 23x its 2011 revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE -14.3%) resumes its three-day 30% swoon since announcing it would replace...

    A123 Systems (AONE -14.3%) resumes its three-day 30% swoon since announcing it would replace battery packs due to a manufacturing defect. Deutsche Bank cuts shares to Hold, saying the estimated $55M cost "represents a severe impact" to a company with just $187M in balance sheet cash at year-end 2011 and that had projected free cash burn of at least $155M in FY2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 2 Comments
  • AUDC

    AudioCodes (AUDC -7.8%) continues its slide since issuing downward guidance, and Oppenheimer is...

    AudioCodes (AUDC -7.8%) continues its slide since issuing downward guidance, and Oppenheimer is cutting its stock rating to Perform. "With the pre-announcement of lowering 2012 forecasts by 13%, we question the stability of the media gateway business to provide a base for continued investment in growth areas," the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • BNNY

    In-line with expectations, Annie's (NYSE:BNNY) opened at $31.11, and is now trading at $33.17,...

    In-line with expectations, Annie's (NYSE:BNNY) opened at $31.11, and is now trading at $33.17, up 75% from an IPO price of $19. This gives the organic macaroni vendor a valuation of $552M. Annie's generated revenue of $98.3M (+21% Y/Y) in the 9 months ending Dec. 31, and net income of $233M. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials (AMAT -1.8%) sells off after guiding for FY12 (ends in October) revenue of...

    Applied Materials (AMAT -1.8%) sells off after guiding for FY12 (ends in October) revenue of $9.1B-$9.5B and EPS of $0.85-$0.95 ahead of its annual shareholder meeting; the figures are below a consensus of $9.6B and $0.96. The chip equipment giant, which was up 20% YTD, blames ongoing weakness in its display and solar equipment businesses. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • FCX

    Freeport-McMoran (FCX -3.9%) hikes its quarterly dividend payout by 25% to $0.3125 per share....

    Freeport-McMoran (FCX -3.9%) hikes its quarterly dividend payout by 25% to $0.3125 per share. Shares of FCX are trading lower on the day - along with a host of other commodity producers - sporting a new bumped-up yield of 3.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • VRML

    Vermillion (VRML +23.2%) says the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office granted a patent on the use...

    Vermillion (VRML +23.2%) says the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office granted a patent on the use of the company's Protein C Inhibitor in tests to measure the presence or progress of ovarian cancer. "The latest patent allowance further strengthens the ovarian cancer franchise behind our lead product, OVA1," VRML's chief science officer says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • AAL

    Airlines stocks show strength in early trading, emboldened by lower oil prices and the increased...

    Airlines stocks show strength in early trading, emboldened by lower oil prices and the increased prospect that the EU carbon tax scheme will fall apart with governments across the globe opposing it. Advancers: LCC +4.1%, UAL +4.1%, DAL +3.5%, JBLU +3.0%, ALGT +2.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • T

    DirecTV (DTV +2%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Citigroup, citing the company's undervalued...

    DirecTV (DTV +2%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Citigroup, citing the company's undervalued Latin American business and buyback potential. The firm also raises its price target to $59 from $48.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • EVRI

    Shares of Global Cash Access (GCA +6.1%) trade higher after Sterne Agree increases its price...

    Shares of Global Cash Access (GCA +6.1%) trade higher after Sterne Agree increases its price target to $11.50 from $8.20. The firm points to an important license the firm nabbed from Nevada to become the only "cash access and wagering instrument service provider" in the state.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • GDOT

    Green Dot (GDOT +2%) moves up on positive comments out of William Blair this morning, saying the...

    Green Dot (GDOT +2%) moves up on positive comments out of William Blair this morning, saying the company's risk/reward profile is very attractive at current levels having already declined 15% year-to-date. The firm says GDOT's fundamental trends remain in place and that the company should perform in line with 2012 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • GOOG

    DigiTimes reports that Google (GOOG +1.5%) this summer will release a 7-inch tablet manufactured...

    DigiTimes reports that Google (GOOG +1.5%) this summer will release a 7-inch tablet manufactured by Taiwan's Asustek. The model is expected to be priced at $199, meant to compete with Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Kindle Fire at the same price. A separate NYÂ Post report has GOOG rolling out a branded tablet at $150.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • VCRA

    Vocera Communications (NYSE:VCRA) is trading at $22.70 on its first day, up 42% from an IPO...

    Vocera Communications (NYSE:VCRA) is trading at $22.70 on its first day, up 42% from an IPO price of $16. Vocera, whose products allow hospital workers to communicate via wireless badges, currently sports a $494M valuation. It posted revenue of $79.5M in 2011 (+40% Y/Y) and a net loss of $2.5M. (previously) (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale (ARO +2%) moves higher after being upgraded to Outperform this morning at Wedbush....

    Aeropostale (ARO +2%) moves higher after being upgraded to Outperform this morning at Wedbush. The firm says ARO is in the early stages of a turnaround and will benefit from improved fashion designs and better inventory control. Its price target is also raised to $26 from $16.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • JOSB

    Shares of Jos. A Bank Clothiers (NASDAQ:JOSB) move down 6.5% after the firm misses the consensus...

    Shares of Jos. A Bank Clothiers (NASDAQ:JOSB) move down 6.5% after the firm misses the consensus EPS estimate of analysts by a penny. Hedgeye turns it focus on the report and calls the move in the sales vs. inventory number the "worst" it's seen in the sector for the quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • NLY

    Annaly (NLY -3.5%) shareholders receive a nice present in the form of stock dilution as the...

    Annaly (NLY -3.5%) shareholders receive a nice present in the form of stock dilution as the company announces the conversion of 772K shares of preferred stock into 2.4M shares of common. It's ex-dividend day and the shares are off a bit more than the $0.55 payout. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 32 Comments
  • BNNY

    After pricing its IPO at $19, shares of organic foods maker Annie's (NYSE:BNNY) is indicated to...

    After pricing its IPO at $19, shares of organic foods maker Annie's (NYSE:BNNY) is indicated to open at $30-$33 a pop.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • BMY

    Amylin (AMLN +47.6%) soars to $22.71 after Bloomberg reports the diabetes drugmaker turned down...

    Amylin (AMLN +47.6%) soars to $22.71 after Bloomberg reports the diabetes drugmaker turned down a $22/share bid from Bristol-Myers Squibb (NYSE:BMY) earlier this year. It's added Bristol-Myers hasn't approached Amylin since the rejection, and the latter company is focused on finding an international marketing partner for its products.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • PRGS

    Progress Software (PRGS -3.4%) shares tumble at the open, as FQ1 earnings fell 64% on declining...

    Progress Software (PRGS -3.4%) shares tumble at the open, as FQ1 earnings fell 64% on declining software license revenue and CFO Charles Wagner Jr. will leave the business software company immediately. Results topped PRGS’s downbeat January forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • FRO

    Shares of shipper Frontline (NYSE:FRO) are upgraded to Buy from Hold at Dahlman Rose, which...

    Shares of shipper Frontline (NYSE:FRO) are upgraded to Buy from Hold at Dahlman Rose, which cites an improved market for tanker rates and a successful restructuring: "The company retains significant spot market exposure, and has resolved the balance sheet issues which served as an overhang over the shares." FRO +7.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • SBUX

    Shares of Teavana Holdings (TEA) fall 7.1% premarket after the firm reports a slight Q4 earnings...

    Shares of Teavana Holdings (TEA) fall 7.1% premarket after the firm reports a slight Q4 earnings beat along with guidance that tipped toward the weak side. The specialty retailer expects an increase in comparable store sales in the mid-single digit range - a mark that doesn't quite sit well with current valuations.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • ZOLT

    Carbon fiber maker Zoltek (NASDAQ:ZOLT) gains 12.4% after announcing a partnership with...

    Carbon fiber maker Zoltek (NASDAQ:ZOLT) gains 12.4% after announcing a partnership with automotive subsystem vendor Magna International (NYSE:MGA) to develop carbon fiber compounds for the automotive market. Needham is responding by upgrading Zoltek to Hold, arguing the deal gives the company a needed foothold in a giant market.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • VICL

    Vical (NASDAQ:VICL) +2.9% premarket after announcing that researchers at a Japan university have...

    Vical (NASDAQ:VICL) +2.9% premarket after announcing that researchers at a Japan university have developed a DNA vaccine candidate using its Vaxfectin adjuvant with the potential to prevent transmission of malaria. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. futures turn negative after disappointing Durable Goods data, with the...

    Market preview: U.S. futures turn negative after disappointing Durable Goods data, with the S&P benchmark -0.1%. Oil is -1.1% following a report that more strategic reserves may be released. Pentair is +18.6% on its merger with Tyco's (+2.5%) flow-control business. Later: Geithner, MF Global hearings
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) shares +3.7% after the firm says it will start selling Windows Lumia smartphones in China from next month. Nokia, which is seeking to recover a plunge in market share from Apple and Samsung, is initially selling the devices through China Telecom (NYSE:CHA), but plans to market its products through the other two big carriers as well.
